title: How to show that for all prime numbers $p$ greater than $3$, $24$ divides $p^2-1$ evenly (elementary number theory, math) - Quora

response.answer_text: if p is prime( and greater than 24) then p must be relatively prime to 24. Since 2 and 3 divides 24, p can be congruent to 1,5,7,11,13,17,19,23. If you square each of these numbers and subtract one you will always get a residue of 0 mod 24.
